page.title: 06Transport in the Eighties.
page.content: Transport has changed an awful lot since the Doomsday book was published. There are many types of cars, and the car market is very big nowadays. Cars are basically the same, they all have either a internal combustion engine, or a fuel injected engine, though, a few do have diesel engines. Aeroplanes on the other hand are not such a big market but lots more money is involved. The aeroplane has two main types of engine, the propellor and the jet. Most aeroplanes are made of steel but gliders are made of fibre glass. Boats are very fast, light and agile. Most boats use a propellor to propel them. But some use other methods. Like the aeroplanes, large liners are made of steel and small boats are made of fibre glass. Overall transport now uses much modern technology.
